prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Madison County (Va.) Records, 1793-1945. Local government records collection, Madison County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Madison County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Madison County was named for James Madison, a prominent Virginian and a member of Congress in 1792 when the county was formed from Culpeper County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Madison County (Va.) Records, 1793-1945, includes miscellaneous records from the following series: Court Records, Tax and Fiscal Records, Road and Bridge Records, Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, Marriage/Vital Statistics, Fiduciary Records, Business Records, Military/Pension Records, Land Records, and Election Records.
Executions, Court Claims, Road Claims, and Estray Warrants
Bonds; Fiduciary bonds; Bonds of fiduciaries, officers, etc.
Birth Registers, Henry Barnes Vouchers and Sale book, account book, official oaths, and license tax assessments

Court Records/Fiduciary Records: Judgments; copy of transcript of chancery suit heard in Supreme Court of Appeals; Papers about chancery suit Shirley vs. Shirley; Papers about chancery suit involving John W. White; Orphan Chancery; Clerk's Records; Fiduciary Records, 1820-1893
Bonds/Commissions/Oaths: Officials' Bonds and Court Records: Constables returns and executions

Unidentified Blacksmith Account Book, 1863-1865; Pages from unidentified account book, 1869-1871; Election Records; Fiduciary Records; Land Records; Military Exemptions, 1862; Military Discharge papers, 1917; Miscellaneous Records: Estray papers, power of attorney, fox scalp warrants, fragments of newspapers and broadsides; Road and Bridge Records; Tax and Fiscal Records, and Bonds/Commissions/Oaths
Depositions, dockets, clerks' records, receipts, wrappers, and fragments
Chancery Index, Circuit Court Issue Dockets, Supervisor's Order Book Index, County Court Fee books, receipt books, blank forms, unidentified indexes, and Personal Property Tax Book
